summary: This is an email chain from January 11, 2019, discussing upcoming activities for the Jeffrey Epstein investigation team. It mentions the team's travel to Florida to meet with original case agents and collect files, and reports the sentencing of a former MCC guard for smuggling contraband.

persons.name: Victor Casado
persons.role: Former supervisory guard at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC)
persons.context: He was sentenced to 36 months in prison for smuggling contraband into the MCC in exchange for bribes totaling tens of thousands of dollars.

events.title: Sentencing of Victor Casado
events.description: Victor Casado, a former supervisory guard at the MCC, was sentenced to 36 months in prison for his role in smuggling contraband into the facility in exchange for bribes.

events.title: Investigation team travel to Florida
events.description: The team working on the Jeffrey Epstein investigation is traveling to Florida to meet with the original case agents and begin collecting hard copy files from the initial investigation.

keyFacts: The Jeffrey Epstein investigation team was actively working in January 2019, planning to travel to Florida to collect files from the original investigation.
Victor Casado, a former supervisory guard at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC), was sentenced to 36 months for smuggling contraband in exchange for bribes.
The email indicates ongoing coordination and information sharing within the investigation team regarding significant legal events.
